Consumer goods being held off our coast must be delivered as soon as possible.

Constituents in my district and all across America are experiencing these frustrating delays - my office will continue to monitor the latest updates.

Poor communication about offloading, shipping, and transportation has also contributed to the bottleneck, along with heightened demands as the U.S. nears holiday season.

As dozens of cargo ships sit off the coast of LA, a review into the root causes of the gridlock is ongoing.

Continuing to keep an eye on the cargo ship gridlock in the Port of Los Angeles- several factors at play, including a sharp increase in the demand for goods, slowed shipping processes from overseas companies during COVID, and truck driver/shipping container shortages.
